name: Capgemini
title: EUR 700M AI Restructuring — Catalyst for Enterprise-Wide AI Adoption

classification.classificationRationale: Decision tree: Formal AI unit? Not described in this source — CEO frames as enterprise-wide pivot ('catalyst for enterprise-wide AI adoption'). Central team? Likely exists but not described. The EUR 700M restructuring is for 'country-specific workforce and skills adaptation initiatives' — suggesting distributed, country-level AI adoption rather than centralized lab. GenAI/agentic AI accounts for 10%+ of Group bookings (already enterprise-wide). M6a: mass adoption without formal named AI structure. Low confidence: single corporate announcement source. Contextual orientation: 'enterprise-wide AI adoption' suggests same people doing both traditional and AI work.

description:
Capgemini announced EUR 700 million in restructuring charges over 2025-2026 (majority in 2026) for 'country-specific workforce and skills adaptation initiatives' to meet surging AI demand. CEO Aiman Ezzat framed this as 'clearly pivoting the Group to be the catalyst for enterprise-wide AI adoption.'

Generative and agentic AI already accounted for over 10% of Group bookings in Q4 2025, indicating substantial market traction. Expected restructuring cash outflows run approximately EUR 200M above 2025 levels. The 340,000-employee organization faces the classic professional services AI tension: restructuring human expertise while selling that same expertise to clients.

The 'catalyst' framing is noteworthy — Ezzat positions Capgemini not as an AI adopter but as the entity that enables other organizations' AI transformations, justifying internal restructuring as necessary to credibly deliver AI services externally.

observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: EUR 700M restructuring charges (2025-2026, majority in 2026). EUR 200M additional cash outflows above 2025 levels [globenewswire-capgemini-2026].
observableMarkers.metrics: 340,000 employees globally. GenAI/agentic AI >10% of Group bookings in Q4 2025 [globenewswire-capgemini-2026].

quotes.text: Clearly pivoting the Group to be the catalyst for enterprise-wide AI adoption.
quotes.speaker: Aiman Ezzat

layers.label: EUR 700M AI Restructuring Program Announced
layers.summary: Capgemini announces EUR 700M restructuring over 2025-2026 for 'country-specific workforce and skills adaptation.' GenAI/agentic AI >10% of Q4 bookings. CEO Ezzat: 'clearly pivoting the Group to be the catalyst for enterprise-wide AI adoption.' 340K employees globally. EUR 200M additional cash outflows above 2025.

sources.name: Capgemini Full-year 2025 results
sources.notes: FY 2025 results announcement containing EUR 700M restructuring disclosure.

openQuestions: Does Capgemini have a CAIO or dedicated AI leadership?
What is the structure of Capgemini's internal AI capabilities vs. client-facing AI services?
How are the 'country-specific workforce and skills adaptation initiatives' structured?
What AI tools and platforms does Capgemini use internally?
How does the EUR 700M restructuring compare to competitors (Accenture, Deloitte, etc.)?
taxonomyFeedback: [2026-02] The 'catalyst for enterprise-wide AI adoption' framing creates a recursive tension: Capgemini sells AI transformation services while undergoing its own AI transformation. This is the professional services paradox — the product is human expertise, but the restructuring reduces human headcount.

[2026-02] Part of the Feb 2026 professional services restructuring wave (Baker McKenzie, Forrester). The EUR 700M scale makes this the largest single AI restructuring investment in the collection by a professional services firm.
